function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Individualized decision-making based on large volumes of data may not be accurate or effective in predicting infected individuals.","Impact":"Mismanagement of infected individuals, leading to further spread of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Utilize complementary approaches such as population-based data and modeling to validate individual predictions.","Technologies":"Data mining, machine learning, and computational modeling for accurate prediction.","People":"Healthcare agencies, research institutions, and public health officials.","Owner":"Healthcare agencies, research institutions, and public health officials."},{"Description":"Challenges related to data security, encryption, ethics, and regulation may arise from the integrated approach of continuous data collection and communication.","Impact":"Potential data breaches, privacy violations, ethical controversies, and regulatory non-compliance.","Mitigation":"Implement robust data security measures, ethical guidelines, and regulatory frameworks for data collection and communication.","Technologies":"Secure communication networks, encryption algorithms, ethical AI frameworks, and regulatory compliance tools.","People":"Researchers, data scientists, healthcare agencies, and regulatory authorities.","Owner":"Researchers, healthcare agencies, and regulatory authorities."},{"Description":"Reliance on data mining and machine learning may lead to over-reliance on correlations and inaccurate predictions.","Impact":"Unreliable predictions, leading to erroneous decision-making and ineffective disease management.","Mitigation":"Combine data-driven approaches with clinical validation and expert input to ensure the accuracy and reliability of predictions.","Technologies":"Data validation tools, clinical decision support systems, and expert consultation platforms.","People":"Data scientists, healthcare professionals, and researchers.","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, research organizations, and public health authorities."}]}
